director.name: 布莱恩·沃尔克-怀斯 Brian Volk-Weiss

this_title: Paul Reiser: Life, Death, and Rice Pudding
introduction: Reiser’s new hour comes on the heels of Paul Reiser: 3 ½ Blocks from Home and Paul Reiser: Out on a Whim, which were respectively released in 1991 and 1987. In it, he discloses the secret to successful downsizing, explains why the whole “Do unto others” thing doesn’t work in marriage, and why boiling pasta naked is never a good idea. And for absolutely no additional charge, you will come to understand why finding raisins in rice pudding underscores the very meaning of life.
chinese_title: Paul Reiser: Life, Death, and Rice Pudding
